fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • An interview with the broadcaster Rylan Clark-Neal referred to him as the stand-in for Zoe Ball’s Saturday afternoon BBC Radio 2 slot. While Clark-Neal had stepped in for Ball last summer, in January his own show, Rylan on Saturday, replaced Ball’s when she moved to the station’s weekday breakfast show (‘I knew I had to be the gay stereotype – I did my job well’, 25 June, page 8, G2). • Other recently corrected articles include: Labour should support leaving the EU – then it can be truly radical in government Arab world turns its back on religion – and its ire on the US Indian Himalayas: seven bodies found in search for missing climbers
